snippet: A House panel investigating the health care rollout questioned Kathleen Sebelius, the health secretary, on Wednesday as new data showed a sharp rise in signups for coverage.
abstract: Obama administration reports that number of people selecting health plans in federal and state marketplaces increased briskly in November 2013, bringing overall figure to nearly 365,000; new data becomes available as Health Secretary Kathleen Sebelius clashes again with Republicans at hearing of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.
lead_paragraph: A House panel investigating the health care rollout questioned Kathleen Sebelius, the health secretary, on Wednesday as new data showed a sharp rise in signups for coverage.

headline.main: U.S. Cites Rise in Health Plan Signups as Sebelius Testifies
headline.print_headline: Sharp Rise in Health Plan Sign-Ups Is Reported

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
